agent_utterance:
Here are exact steps to set up two daily alerts on iPhone and Android. Title labels use a simple '3 PM snack' for the snack alert and 'Prep 3 PM snack' for the prep alert.

iPhone (Reminders app)
1) Open Reminders.
2) Create a new reminder: type "Prep 3 PM snack".
3) Tap the info (i) button next to it.
4) Turn on Remind me on a day and Remind me at a time.
5) Set Date to Today (or tomorrow if it’s already past 2:50).
6) Set Time to 2:50 PM.
7) Set Repeat to Daily.
8) Save.
9) Create another reminder: name “3 PM snack”.
10) Repeat steps 4–8, but set Time to 3:00 PM.

Alternative: iPhone Clock alarms (works even if reminders isn’t your thing)
1) Open Clock > Alarm > + (Add).
2) Time: 2:50 PM.
3) Label: "Prep 3 PM snack".
4) Repeat: Daily.
5) Save.
6) Add a second alarm at 3:00 PM labeled "3 PM snack" and set Repeat to Daily.

Android (Clock app)
1) Open Clock > Alarm > + (Add).
2) Time: 2:50 PM.
3) Label: "Prep 3 PM snack".
4) Repeat: Daily (or Every day).
5) Save.
6) Add a second alarm at 3:00 PM with Label "3 PM snack" and Repeat: Daily, then Save.

Android alternative (Google Calendar)
1) Open Google Calendar.
2) Create event for today at 2:50 PM titled "Prep 3 PM snack".
3) Set Repeat to Daily and add a notification (e.g., at 0 minutes before).
4) Create another event for today at 3:00 PM titled "3 PM snack".
5) Set Repeat to Daily and add a notification at 0 minutes before.

If you’d like, tell me your exact phone model and OS version and I’ll tailor the steps to your device precisely. And remember: if you miss a day, no problem—just try again tomorrow. You can rotate snack options later when it feels comfortable.
